caption: I was in a nearby shopping centre and I was walking down the street and looking at the shop windows, when I suddenly saw a corridor and at the end of it something that looked like a church. I came to take a look because I was curious about what this church looked like from the inside. By pure chance, service started a minute after that, so I sat down and enjoyed the one-hour service in French. I didn't understand anything, but after a while I found out that they were saying exactly the same thing as at my home country. Same sequence, same tones. For the first time, I saw people sitting around the altar in the church. I then asked people and they said that this is a special church. There is usually an altar at the end and you sit in front of it. If you are a believer and you happen to be passing by, go take a look. It's worth it.
there were a line to take the photo with the mirror
Discreet Jesuit church with no hubbub hidden in the heart of the sixth arrondissement. No pomp, no grandiose. Just God.

I strongly recommend to take part at the Sunday night mass at 7. The mass is organised differently. People take active part in praying and completing the Gospel and the lectures. If you are looking for a place to know young Chrstian community. You are in the right spot.
Excellent. Nice picture of Blessed Baby Jesus and Virgin Mary. Jezuits( SJ) have Holy Mass every day here.
An amazing church with wonderful pastoral care... 3 masses daily and a quiet place to sit or pray...
Surprising church which is hidden. Nice side chapels and interesting liturgical positioning.
"THE" church in Paris üî•
Hidden and beautiful Church.
Yeah.. nice place!
Beautiful place
Magnificent mass which takes its time (MT) to be repeated on Sunday evening with only young people. An extraordinary experience.

A secret church, totally invisible from the street and dedicated (which goes quite well with its lack of visibility) to Ignatius of Loyola, Francois Xavier and the Jesuits. And it is a beautiful church, although undoubtedly a little cold, recently renovated and where we find beautiful altars and sculptures dedicated to the numerous martyrs of the order.  And we must mention the welcome, pleasant, serene, consistent with the image of the Company.
Its location is well hidden but it deserves to be 'recognized', it is bright and slender. It is located not far from the metro on a very busy street.
Rare exhibition. Arcabas to discover: colorful ‚Äúearthly‚Äù palette blending figurative and abstract. To have.

From a strict architectural point of view, this church is very interesting and really makes you think of a hidden gem: from the street, it is completely invisible. He enters a modern building and then lands in the Gothic nave which seems to come straight from the Middle Ages (even if it is in reality modern and only dates back to the 19th century. The interior is very well maintained and the chapels on the sides are very beautiful. To visit !
The Saint-Ignace de Loyola Church is a Jesuit church. There are several masses during the day and weekend. On Sunday there is a mass for young people. It's really interesting.

Paris spits out many secrets, like this church, invisible from the street, except for a modern sign indicating it. It hosted the Nuit Blanche in 2020. It allows you to admire not only the Gauthic architecture, but also the way in which the churches of the time were painted inside. It houses a copy of the icon of Our Lady of Vladimir de Rublev.

Hidden Catholic church in the 7th district of Paris. Inaugurated in 1858. (Jesuit church named after St. Ignatius of Loyola. Very beautiful. A must see. Next to the very renowned Catholic university, THE SEVRES CENTER. Rue de Sevres. Metro Sevres Babylone
Hidden among the buildings is this place of prayer in Gothic style but from the modern era.

Beautiful, beautiful! In France I was amazed to see the churches full of men and women, even young ones, and above all many families with several children! I thought that Christians here preserve and follow the Christian tradition. Congratulations to you French Christians.
A simple and welcoming place of contemplation, accompanied on Sundays by magnificent music.
The church has been renovated and it is a success. So, participating in mass which takes its time with many great young people is a precious moment in the spiritual life.
The majesty of eternal Rome is realized in this unique and majestic place. "Take care of your beauty, in Infinite Space" Sant'Ignazio Roma
Very pretty nave, in particular with pretty stained glass windows, in this hidden church, but also protected against pollution, by a building on rue de S√®vres.

Easter Vigil Mass, I arrive 1 hour early because I know the ceremony will be beautiful...what a shame once the church is full we are told to leave because there are more priests than expected: not a shadow of a word sorry no one tried to find us a place...Easter day or was the Christian feeling of this community...I return without mass with anger, far from the expected Easter joy.... .

Magnificent church where I finally found a painting of the crucifixion of Jesus consistent with reality: one here, one there. Which is extremely rare. Coming back on the right. Bravo for your dedication.
Very unusual church You wouldn't think you were entering a church to see
For Bible reading and meditation, I found the ideal place Thank you Saint Ignatius ‚ù§Ô∏è

Magnificent church Too bad it‚Äôs not marked with a bigger sign. Leaving the chapel on rue du bac I will always reflect, she is magnificent. I think the cross is too small, you really have to look up to see it

It's a beautiful church. It has decorative elements which are very old, which testify to the tastes of an era which is not ours, but which are matched by elegant new elements, which soberly embellish it.  She is very discreet, because you cannot see her from the street.  Outside of the offices, there is a calm, soothing atmosphere, conducive to meditation, therefore to personal prayer, in great peace.  I really like this Catholic church.

Very beautiful church where it is good to gather in the heart of Paris, opposite the Bon March√©. In neo-Gothic style, it is dedicated to Saint Ignatius, founder of the Jesuits. If you want to speak with one of them, there is a reception desk every day and they provide good advice.

Church of the Jesuit fathers, located near the S√®vres-Babylone metro station and the Le Bon March√© department store. Excellent place of calm, prayer, meditation and rejuvenation. The layout of the church makes it easier for everyone to participate and allows the faithful to be better grouped together. On the walls, beautiful, recently restored frescoes illustrate important moments in the life of St Ignatius of Loyola, St Francis Xavier, and various Jesuit saints and martyrs.  Absolutely worth knowing.
Place marked by the presence of Christ and numerous missionary saints
I discovered this church (well hidden because not visible from the street) during a tribute to a deceased friend and was dazzled by its simplicity and beauty.

A little gem in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Dark like the churches of that time. Beautiful stained glass windows. Very nice organ for connoisseurs. On my last visit it seems to me that guides give you the tour - I didn't try it myself with my old mother. Compared to Notre Dame it is much calmer!
Beautiful Catholic church of the Jesuit order.  It is hidden between two buildings...  There is the possibility of having a spiritual exchange with a priest or a nun.
I really like this secret place...
